title: Large abomination
data:
***Version [0.32](/0.32 "0.32")**: This article is up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of *Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup*.*

| large abomination X [![Large abomination.png](/images/5/51/Large_abomination.png)](/File:Large_abomination.png) |                                                                                                                                                                         |

| - | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A hideous conglomeration of mangled body parts, possessed and altered in ways that challenge sanity. Each varies in speed, strength, or resilience by the nature of whatever unfortunates were used to make it. |

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [3 Alternate Tiles](#Alternate_Tiles)
- [4 History](#History)

## Useful Info

**Large abominations** are enormous piles of roughly connected humanoid body parts, and much more dangerous than their [smaller](/Small_abomination "Small abomination") counterparts. They spawn with haste, might, or regeneration as a permanent buff. No matter their buff, they always deal significant damage in melee. They are often found in [the Abyss](/The_Abyss "The Abyss") and occasionally in parts of [Pandemonium](/Pandemonium "Pandemonium").

## Tips & Tricks

- Their [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower") is moderately high: don't expect [Hexes](/Hexes "Hexes") or hex [wands](/Wand "Wand") to do much unless they are at high power.
- They are vulnerable to [Dispel Undead](/Dispel_Undead "Dispel Undead").

## Alternate Tiles

Being haphazard collections of random body parts, large abominations can take many forms:

[![Abomination large.png](/images/b/bd/Abomination_large.png)](/File:Abomination_large.png) [![Abomination large1.png](/images/c/cc/Abomination_large1.png)](/File:Abomination_large1.png) [![Abomination large2.png](/images/f/ff/Abomination_large2.png)](/File:Abomination_large2.png) [![Abomination large3.png](/images/9/99/Abomination_large3.png)](/File:Abomination_large3.png) [![Abomination large4.png](/images/2/2a/Abomination_large4.png)](/File:Abomination_large4.png) [![Abomination large5.png](/images/1/11/Abomination_large5.png)](/File:Abomination_large5.png) [![Abomination large6.png](/images/a/a0/Abomination_large6.png)](/File:Abomination_large6.png) [![Abomination large7.png](/images/c/ca/Abomination_large7.png)](/File:Abomination_large7.png) [![Abomination large8.png](/images/9/98/Abomination_large8.png)](/File:Abomination_large8.png) [![Large abomination.png](/images/5/51/Large_abomination.png)](/File:Large_abomination.png)

In console, they can be any manner of colors. Neither the alternate tiles nor colors indicate anything about their stats.

## History

- Prior to [0.32](/0.32 "0.32"), large abominations had randomized attributes instead of spawning with a permanent buff. Also, they did not regenerate.
- Prior to [0.31](/0.31 "0.31"), large abominations had randomized speed (6-12).
- Prior to [0.27](/0.27 "0.27"), large abominations could heal by merging with [crawling corpses](/Crawling_corpse "Crawling corpse") and [macabre masses](/Macabre_mass "Macabre mass"). Also, monsters could cast [Twisted Resurrection](/Twisted_Resurrection "Twisted Resurrection") to create large abominations.
- Prior to [0.16](/0.16 "0.16"), players could also cast Twisted Resurrection.
- Prior to [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), abominations could regenerate naturally.

Large abomination

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.32: This article is up to date for the latest stable release of Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup.
large abomination X 
HP 32-66
HD 11
XP 719
Speed 10
AC 11
EV 6
Will 100
Attack1 32 (hit: plain)


Resistances rPois+++
rDrown
rMiasma
rN+++
rTorm
Vulnerabilities Holy
Silver
Habitat Land
Intelligence Brainless
Uses Uses nothing
Holiness Undead
Size Large
Type small abomination, large abomination
Flags Evil
Unbreathing
A hideous conglomeration of mangled body parts, possessed and altered in ways that challenge sanity. Each varies in speed, strength, or resilience by the nature of whatever unfortunates were used to make it.

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
  • 2 Tips & Tricks
  • 3 Alternate Tiles
  • 4 History

Useful Info

Large abominations are enormous piles of roughly connected humanoid body parts, and much more dangerous than their smaller counterparts. They spawn with haste, might, or regeneration as a permanent buff. No matter their buff, they always deal significant damage in melee. They are often found in the Abyss and occasionally in parts of Pandemonium.

Tips & Tricks

  • Their willpower is moderately high: don't expect Hexes or hex wands to do much unless they are at high power.
  • They are vulnerable to Dispel Undead.

Alternate Tiles

Being haphazard collections of random body parts, large abominations can take many forms:

In console, they can be any manner of colors. Neither the alternate tiles nor colors indicate anything about their stats.

History

  • Prior to 0.32, large abominations had randomized attributes instead of spawning with a permanent buff. Also, they did not regenerate.
  • Prior to 0.31, large abominations had randomized speed (6-12).
  • Prior to 0.27, large abominations could heal by merging with crawling corpses and macabre masses. Also, monsters could cast Twisted Resurrection to create large abominations.
  • Prior to 0.16, players could also cast Twisted Resurrection.
  • Prior to 0.14, abominations could regenerate naturally.

rawPage:
{{version032}}
{{monster info}}

==Useful Info==
'''Large abominations''' are enormous piles of roughly connected humanoid body parts, and much more dangerous than their [[small abomination|smaller]] counterparts. They spawn with haste, might, or regeneration as a permanent buff. No matter their buff, they always deal significant damage in melee. They are often found in [[the Abyss]] and occasionally in parts of [[Pandemonium]].

==Tips & Tricks==
*Their [[willpower]] is moderately high: don't expect [[Hexes]] or hex [[wand]]s to do much unless they are at high power.
*They are vulnerable to [[Dispel Undead]].

==Alternate Tiles==
Being haphazard collections of random body parts, large abominations can take many forms:

[[Image:Abomination large.png]]  [[Image:Abomination large1.png]] [[Image:Abomination large2.png]] [[Image:Abomination large3.png]] [[Image:Abomination large4.png]] [[Image:Abomination large5.png]] [[Image:Abomination large6.png]] [[Image:Abomination large7.png]] [[Image:Abomination large8.png]] [[Image:Large abomination.png]]

In console, they can be any manner of colors. Neither the alternate tiles nor colors indicate anything about their stats.

==History==
*Prior to [[0.32]], large abominations had randomized attributes instead of spawning with a permanent buff. Also, they did not regenerate.
*Prior to [[0.31]], large abominations had randomized speed (6-12).
*Prior to [[0.27]], large abominations could heal by merging with [[crawling corpse]]s and [[macabre mass]]es. Also, monsters could cast [[Twisted Resurrection]] to create large abominations.
*Prior to [[0.16]], players could also cast Twisted Resurrection.
*Prior to [[0.14]], abominations could regenerate naturally.
